attachments.text:
### Pull Request Checklist

#### Cluster Testing

• If a cluster test is required, comment `/cluster_test` on this PR to request it, and ping someone with access to the DA-internal system to approve it.
• If a hard-migration test is required (from the latest release), comment `/hdm_test` on this PR to request it, and ping someone with access to the DA-internal system to approve it.

#### PR Guidelines

• Include any change that might be observable by our partners or affect their deployment in the <https://github.com/DACH-NY/canton-network-node/blob/main/cluster/images/docs/src/release_notes.rst|release notes>.
• Specify fixed issues with `Fixes #n`, and mention issues worked on using `#n`
• Include a screenshot for frontend-related PRs - see <https://github.com/DACH-NY/canton-network-node#running-and-debugging-integration-tests|README> or use your favorite screenshot tool

#### Merge Guidelines

• Make the git commit message look sensible when squash-merging on GitHub (most likely: just copy your PR description).

Hi, we need new IP whitelist for our mainnet validators.

We reached the limit of our first IP, so we had to attach new ones to the same NAT gateway.
(our last validator deployment is currently stuck, and the existing ones might encounter issues if restarted with one of the new IPs)

Can we get them whitelisted for mainnet?
• 35.187.124.60 (already whitelisted)
• 34.76.215.95
• 35.233.83.194
• 34.77.242.47
Thanks

text: in docs
Thank you Stef :raised_hands:

Hey guys, I have a question.
 When I updated from version 3.21 to 0.4.0, I had to change the migration ID. After doing that, it created a new database, and I lost all the funds in the wallet. This happened on devnet, so it's not a big issue, but how should we handle this kind of update on mainnet to avoid losing funds in the wallet?

elements.text:
Hey guys, I have a question.
 When I updated from version 3.21 to 0.4.0, I had to change the migration ID. After doing that, it created a new database, and I lost all the funds in the wallet. This happened on devnet, so it's not a big issue, but how should we handle this kind of update on mainnet to avoid losing funds in the wallet?

text: Only the participant needs a new database. Is it possible you also created a new database for the validator? The validator should continue to use the same database.
